newsitem.title: SPAIN: Analysts see Repsol 9-mth profit down 3.6 pct.
newsitem.headline: Analysts see Repsol 9-mth profit down 3.6 pct.

text.p: Spanish energy group Repsol will next week post around a 3.6 percent fall in net profit to 88.81 billion pesetas in the nine months to September, analysts said.
They forecast continuing weakness in the chemicals division but were mixed on how badly the marketing and refining division was performing.
"The petrol price war and the delay in passing on a rise in the price of crude to the consumer will be reflected negatively in refining," said an analyst at Ibersecurities brokerage in Madrid.
Analysts highlighted the inclusion of Argentine refinery Astra ASTA.S in consolidated accounts, which should increase Repsol's operating profits by 1.0-2.0 billion pesetas.
A fall in financial income was also highlighted, while expenses will have benefitted from lower interest rates on debt.
The government is due to place its remaining 10 percent in Repsol on the Spanish bourse early next year.
